timing.F90

00001 module timing
00002 
00003   use constants, only: ZERO
00004 
00005   implicit none
00006 
00007 !===============================================================================
00008 ! TIMER represents a timer that can be started and stopped to measure how long
00009 ! different routines run. The intrinsic routine system_clock is used to measure
00010 ! time rather than cpu_time.
00011 !===============================================================================
00012 
00013   type Timer
00014      logical :: running      = .false. ! is timer running?
00015      integer :: start_counts = 0       ! counts when started
00016      real(8) :: elapsed      = 0.      ! total time elapsed in seconds
00017 !!$   contains
00018 !!$     procedure :: start     => timer_start
00019 !!$     procedure :: get_value => timer_get_value
00020 !!$     procedure :: stop      => timer_stop
00021 !!$     procedure :: reset     => timer_reset
00022   end type Timer
00023 
00024 contains
00025 
00026 !===============================================================================
00027 ! TIMER_START
00028 !===============================================================================
00029 
00030   subroutine timer_start(self)
00031 
00032     type(Timer), intent(inout) :: self
00033 
00034     ! Turn timer on and measure starting time
00035     self % running = .true.
00036     call system_clock(self % start_counts)
00037 
00038   end subroutine timer_start
00039 
00040 !===============================================================================
00041 ! TIMER_GET_VALUE
00042 !===============================================================================
00043 
00044   function timer_get_value(self) result(elapsed)
00045 
00046     type(Timer), intent(in) :: self   ! the timer
00047     real(8)                 :: elapsed ! total elapsed time
00048 
00049     integer :: end_counts   ! current number of counts
00050     integer :: count_rate   ! system-dependent counting rate
00051     real    :: elapsed_time ! elapsed time since last start
00052 
00053     if (self % running) then
00054        call system_clock(end_counts, count_rate)
00055        elapsed_time = real(end_counts - self % start_counts)/real(count_rate)
00056        elapsed = self % elapsed + elapsed_time
00057     else
00058        elapsed = self % elapsed
00059     end if
00060 
00061   end function timer_get_value
00062 
00063 !===============================================================================
00064 ! TIMER_STOP
00065 !===============================================================================
00066 
00067   subroutine timer_stop(self)
00068 
00069     type(Timer), intent(inout) :: self
00070 
00071     ! Check to make sure timer was running
00072     if (.not. self % running) return
00073 
00074     ! Stop timer and add time
00075     self % elapsed = timer_get_value(self)
00076     self % running = .false.
00077 
00078   end subroutine timer_stop
00079 
00080 !===============================================================================
00081 ! TIMER_RESET
00082 !===============================================================================
00083 
00084   subroutine timer_reset(self)
00085 
00086     type(Timer), intent(inout) :: self
00087 
00088     self % running      = .false.
00089     self % start_counts = 0
00090     self % elapsed      = ZERO
00091 
00092   end subroutine timer_reset
00093 
00094 end module timing
